Package com.jimmyselectronics.virgilio

Class ElectronicScale

java.lang.Object
com.jimmyselectronics.AbstractDevice<ElectronicScaleListener>
com.jimmyselectronics.virgilio.ElectronicScale
public class ElectronicScale extends AbstractDevice<ElectronicScaleListener>
Represents electronic scales on which can be placed one or more items. Scales have a sensitivity: changes to the weight smaller than this will go unnoticed. Scales have a weight limit as well; when the items on the scale are heavier than this limit, the scale cannot operate.
Author:
Jimmy's Electronics LLP

  • Constructor Details

    • ElectronicScale

      public ElectronicScale(double weightLimitInGrams, double sensitivity)
      Constructs an electronic scale with the indicated maximum weight that it can handle before going into overload. The constructed scale will initially be in the configuration phase.
      Parameters:
      weightLimitInGrams - The weight threshold beyond which the scale will overload.
      sensitivity - The number of grams that can be added or removed since the last change event, without causing a new change event.
      Throws:
      SimulationException - If either argument is ≤0.

  • Method Details

    • getWeightLimit

      public double getWeightLimit()
      Gets the weight limit for the scale. Weights greater than this will not be weighable by the scale, but will cause overload. Does not require power.
      Returns:
      The weight limit.

    • getCurrentWeight

      public double getCurrentWeight() throws OverloadException
      Gets the current weight on the scale. Requires power.
      Returns:
      The current weight.
      Throws:
      OverloadException - If the weight has overloaded the scale.

    • getSensitivity

      public double getSensitivity()
      Gets the sensitivity of the scale. Changes smaller than this limit are not noticed or announced. Does not require power.
      Returns:
      The sensitivity.

    • add

      public void add(Item item)
      Adds an item to the scale. If the addition is successful, a weight changed event is announced. If the weight is greater than the weight limit, announces "overload" event. Requires power.
      Parameters:
      item - The item to add.
      Throws:
      SimulationException - If the same item is added more than once or is null.

    • remove

      public void remove(Item item)
      Removes an item from the scale. If the operation is successful, announces "weightChanged" event. If the scale was overloaded and this removal causes it to no longer be overloaded, announces "outOfOverload" event. Does not require power.
      Parameters:
      item - The item to remove.
      Throws:
      SimulationException - If the item is not on the scale (including if it is null).
